5.verse: David said, “Solomon my son is young and inexperienced and the House that is to be built for ADONAI must be exceedingly magnificent, famous and glorious throughout all the nations. Therefore I will make preparation for it.” So David made extensive preparations before his death.

6.verse: Then He called for Solomon his son, and charged him to build a House for ADONAI, the God of Israel.

7.verse: David said to Solomon, “My son, I had it in my heart to build a House for the name of ADONAI my God.

8.verse: But the word of ADONAI came to me, saying, ‘You have shed much blood and fought many battles. You will not build a House for My Name because you have shed much blood before Me on the earth.

9.verse: Behold, a son will be born to you who will be a man at rest. I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side. His name will be Solomon and I will confer shalom and quietness on Israel in his days.

10.verse: He will build a House for My name; he will be My son and I will be His Father. I will establish his royal throne over Israel forever.’

11.verse: “Now, my son, may ADONAI be with you, and may you succeed in building the House of ADONAI your God as He spoke concerning you.

12.verse: Only may ADONAI give you insight and understanding when He gives you charge over Israel so that you may observe the Torah of ADONAI your God.

13.verse: Then you will prosper, if you carefully observe the statutes and the ordinances that ADONAI commanded Moses concerning Israel. Chazak! And be courageous! Do not be afraid or dismayed.

14.verse: “Now behold, with great pain I have provided for the House of ADONAI 100,000 talents of gold, a million talents of silver, and bronze and iron beyond weighing for there is so much of it. I have also prepared wood and stone, and you must add to them.

15.verse: Moreover, you have an abundance of workmen: stonecutters, masons, carpenters and every kind of craftsmen skilled in every kind of material—

16.verse: in gold, silver, bronze and iron—beyond number. Arise and work! May ADONAI be with you.”

17.verse: David also commanded all the leaders of Israel to help Solomon his son,

18.verse: “Is not ADONAI your God with you? Has He not given you rest on every side? For He has delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand and the land is subdued before ADONAI and before His people.

19.verse: Now set your hearts and souls to seek after ADONAI your God. Rise up and build the Sanctuary of ADONAI Elohim so that you can bring the Ark of the Covenant of ADONAI and the holy vessels of God into the House built for the Name of ADONAI.”

1.verse: Census of Levites - When David was old and full of days, he made his son Solomon king over Israel.

2.verse: He also gathered together all the leaders of Israel along with the kohanim and the Levites.

3.verse: The Levites 30 years old or more were counted; their head count was 38,000 men.

4.verse: Of these, there were 24,000 to oversee the work of the House of ADONAI, 6,000 officers and judges,

5.verse: 4,000 gatekeepers, and 4,000 for praising ADONAI “with the instruments which I made for giving praise.”

6.verse: David organized them into divisions: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.

7.verse: Of the Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.

8.verse: The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the leader, Zetham and Joel—three.

9.verse: The sons of Shimei: Shelomith, Haziel and Haran—three. These were the heads of the clans of Ladan.

10.verse: The sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush and Beriah. These were the sons of Shimei—four.

11.verse: Jahath was the first and Zizah the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, so they were enrolled together as a single clan.

12.verse: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel—four.

13.verse: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Aaron, along with his descendants, was set apart to be consecrated as most holy forever, to burn incense before ADONAI, to minister to Him, and to bless in His name forever.

14.verse: But as for Moses the man of God, his sons are named among the tribe of Levi.

15.verse: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.

16.verse: The sons of Gershom: Shebuel, the leader.

17.verse: The sons of Eliezer: Rehabiah the chief. Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very numerous.

18.verse: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith the leader.

19.verse: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third and Jekameam the fourth.

20.verse: The sons of Uzziel: Micah the first and Isshiah the second.

21.verse: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.

22.verse: Eleazar died having no sons but only daughters; the sons of Kish, their kinsmen, took them as wives.

23.verse: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Yeremot—three.

24.verse: These were the sons of Levi by clans, with the heads of clans as they were enrolled and with a list of their names by heads who carried out the task of avodah in the House of ADONAI from 20 years old and upward.

25.verse: For David said: “ADONAI, the God of Israel, has given His people rest and He dwells in Jerusalem forever.

26.verse: Therefore, the Levites need not carry the Tabernacle and all the vessels for avodah.”

27.verse: For according to David’s final instructions, the Levites 20 years old and upward were counted.

28.verse: For their duty was to help the descendants of Aaron in the avodah of ADONAI’s House concerning the courtyards and rooms, the purification of all holy things and the performance of the avodah of God’s House,

29.verse: the rows of bread, the fine flour for the grain offering, the matzot, the cake baked on the griddle or mixed and every measure of capacity and length,

30.verse: and to stand every morning to thank and praise ADONAI. They also did this in the evening

31.verse: and whenever burnt offerings were offered to ADONAI on Shabbatot, New Moons and the moadim. They were to serve regularly before ADONAI, according to the proper number in the manner prescribed for them.

32.verse: They were to keep watch over the Tent of Meeting, the Holy Place and the sons of Aaron their kinsmen for avodah in the House of ADONAI.

1.verse: Now these were the divisions of the sons of Aaron. The sons of Aaron were Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

2.verse: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father and had no children, so Eleazar and Ithamar served as kohanim.

3.verse: David, with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them into their offices according to their avodah.

4.verse: More leading men were found among the sons of Eleazar than among the sons of Ithamar, so they divided them: the sons of Eleazar had 16 leaders of clans and the sons of Ithamar had eight leaders of clans.

5.verse: Thus, they were impartially divided by lot for there were officials of the Holy Place and officials of God, both from the sons of Eleazar and from the sons of Ithamar.

6.verse: The scribe Shemaiah, son of Nethanel from the Levites, recorded them in the presence of the king, the princes, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and the leaders of the clans of the kohanim and of the Levites: one clan taken for Eleazar and one for Ithamar.

7.verse: Now the first lot came for Jehoiarib, the second for Jedaiah,

8.verse: the third for Harim, the fourth for Seorim,

9.verse: the fifth for Malchijah, the sixth for Mijamin,

10.verse: the seventh for Hakkoz, the eighth for Abijah,

11.verse: the ninth for Jeshua, the tenth for Shecaniah,

12.verse: the eleventh for Eliashib, the twelfth for Jakim,

13.verse: the thirteenth for Huppah, the fourteenth for Heshebeab,

14.verse: the fifteenth for Bilgah, the sixteenth for Immer,

15.verse: the seventeenth for Hezir, the eighteenth for Hapizzez,

16.verse: the nineteenth for Petahiah the twentieth for Jehezkel,

17.verse: the twentyfirst for Jachin, the twentysecond for Gamul,

18.verse: the twentythird for Delaiah, the twentyfourth for Maaziah.

19.verse: These were their duties for their avodah upon entering into the House of ADONAI according to the ordinance given to them by the hand of Aaron their father, just as ADONAI the God of Israel had commanded him.

20.verse: As for the rest of the sons of Levi: from the sons of Amram: Shubael; from the sons of Shubael: Jehdeiah.

21.verse: As for Rehabiah, from the sons of Rehabiah Isshiah was the first.

22.verse: From the Izharites: Shelomoth; from the sons of Shelomoth: Jahath.

23.verse: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.

24.verse: The sons of Uzziel: Micah; from the sons of Micah: Shamir.

25.verse: The brother of Micah, Ishiah; from the sons of Ishiah: Zechariah.

26.verse: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi; the sons of Jaaziah: Beno.

27.verse: The sons of Merari: from Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zaccur and Ibri.

28.verse: From Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.

29.verse: From Kish, the sons of Kish: Jerahmeel.

30.verse: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites by their clans.

31.verse: These also cast lots even as their kinsmen the sons of Aaron did in the presence of King David, Zadok, Ahimelech and the heads of the clans of the kohanim and the Levites—the families of the oldest just like those of his youngest brother.

1.verse: Orders of Prophetic Levites - Moreover, David and the commanders of the army, set apart for avodah the sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun who prophesied with lyres, harps and cymbals. The list of those who performed this work according to their service was:

2.verse: from the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah. The sons of Asaph were under the supervision of Asaph, who prophesied under the hand of the king.

3.verse: As for Jeduthun, from Jeduthun’s sons: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Hashabiah and Mattithiah—six, under the charge of their father Jeduthun—who prophesied with the harp, giving thanks and praise to ADONAI.

4.verse: As for Heman, from Heman’s sons: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir and Mahazioth.

5.verse: All these were the sons of Heman the king’s seer according to the promise of God to lift up a horn. God gave Heman 14 sons and three daughters.

6.verse: All these were under the direction of their father for singing in the House of ADONAI with cymbals, harps and lyres for the avodah of the House of God under the hand of the king. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman along with

7.verse: with their kinsmen all trained and skillfull singers of ADONAI, numbered 288.

8.verse: They cast lots for their divisions on the principal of small and great alike, teacher as well as student.

9.verse: Now the first lot went to Asaph’s son Joseph—12 the second to Gedaliah, his brothers and sons—12;

10.verse: the third to Zaccur, his sons and his brothers—12;

11.verse: the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brothers—12;

12.verse: the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons and his brothers—12;

13.verse: the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and his brothers—12;

14.verse: the seventh to Jesarelah, his sons and his brothers—12;

15.verse: the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons and his brothers—12;

16.verse: the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers—12;

17.verse: the tenth to Shimei, his sons and his brothers—12;

18.verse: the 11th to Azarel, his sons and his brothers—12;

19.verse: the 12th to Hashabiah, his sons and his brothers—12;

20.verse: the 13th to Shubael, his sons and his brothers—12;

21.verse: the 14th to Mattithiah, his sons and his brothers—12;

22.verse: the 15th to Jeremoth, his sons and his brothers—12;

23.verse: the 16th to Hananiah, his sons and his brothers—12;

24.verse: the 17th to Joshbekashah, his sons and his brothers—12;

25.verse: the 18th to Hanani, his sons and his brothers—12;

26.verse: the 19th to Mallothi, his sons and his brothers—12;

27.verse: the 20th to Eliathah, his sons and his brothers—12;

28.verse: the 21st to Hothir, his sons and his brothers—12;

29.verse: the 22nd to Giddalti, his sons and his brothers—12;

30.verse: the 23rd to Mahazioth, his sons and his brothers—12;

31.verse: the 24th to Romamti-ezer, his sons and his brothers—12.

1.verse: Gatekeepers and Treasurers - The divisions of the gatekeepers: of the Korahites: Meshelemiah son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.

2.verse: Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,

3.verse: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, and Eliehoenai the seventh.

4.verse: Obed-edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,

5.verse: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, and Peullethai the eighth, (for God had blessed him).

6.verse: To his son Shemaiah were born sons who were leaders of their clans, for they were men of great ability.

7.verse: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, Rephael, Obed and Elzabad. His brothers Elihu and Semachiah were also valiant men.

8.verse: All these were descendants of Obed-edom. They and their sons and their kinsmen were capable men with the strength to do the work—62 of Obed-edom.

9.verse: Meshelemiah had sons and brothers—18 able men.

10.verse: Also Hosah, a descendant of Merari, had sons: Shimri the first (although he was not the firstborn, his father made him the first),

11.verse: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, and Zechariah the fourth. All the sons and brothers of Hosah were 13.

12.verse: These divisions of the gatekeepers by their chief men had duties corresponding to their kinsmen for avodah in the House of ADONAI.

13.verse: So they cast lots, small and great alike, by clans for each gate.

14.verse: The lot for the east gate fell to Shelemiah. Then they cast lots for Zechariah his son, an insightful counselor, and his lot came out for the north gate.

15.verse: To Obed-edom the south gate and to his sons the storehouse.

16.verse: To Shuppim and Hosah the east gate by the Shallecheth gate on the ascending highway. Guard corresponded to guard.

17.verse: There were six Levites on the east, four a day on the north, four a day on the south, and at the storehouse by pairs.

18.verse: At the colonnade on the west, there were four on the road and two at the colonnade itself.

19.verse: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers of the sons of Korah and the sons of Merari.

20.verse: And the Levites: Ahijah was over the treasuries of the House of God and the treasuries of the dedicated things.

21.verse: The descendants of Ladan who were sons of Gershon through Ladan and were chiefs of the clans of Ladan the Gershonite were Jehieli,

22.verse: the sons of Jehieli, Zetham and Joel his brother. They were over the treasuries of the House of ADONAI.

23.verse: Of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, the Uzzielites:

24.verse: Shebuel son of Gershom son of Moses was officer over the treasuries.

25.verse: His relatives through Eliezer: Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zichri his son and Shelomith his son.

26.verse: This Shelomith and his kinsmen were over all the treasuries of the dedicated things that King David and the chiefs of the clans and the commanders over thousands and hundreds, and other army commanders had dedicated.

27.verse: They dedicated some of the plunder taken in battles to maintain the House of ADONAI.

28.verse: All that Samuel the seer, Saul son of Kish, Abner son of Ner and Joab son of Zeruiah had dedicated, and any other dedicated thing was in the care of Shelomith and his relatives.

29.verse: Of the Izharites: Henaniah and his sons were assigned outside duties as officers and judges over Israel.

30.verse: Of the Hebronites: Hashabiah and his brothers, 1,700 capable men, had oversight of Israel west of the Jordan for all the work of ADONAI and for the king’s service.

31.verse: As for the Hebronites: Jerijah was the chief of the Hebronites according to the genealogical records of their families. In the fortieth year of David’s reign a search was made and found in them were valiant men in Jazer of Gilead.

32.verse: His relatives, 2,700 men of valor, were heads of clans whom King David had appointed over the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of the Manasseh in every matter pertaining to God and the affairs of the king.

1.verse: David’s Officers - The number of Bnei-Yisrael—heads of clans, officers of thousands and hundreds, and their officers who served the king in all matters of the divisions that came in and went out month by month throughout the year—each division had 24,000.

2.verse: Over the first division, for the first month, was Jashobeam son of Zabdiel. His division had 24,000.

3.verse: He was a descendant of Perez, the head of all the officers of the army for the first month.

4.verse: Over the division of the second month was Dodai the Ahohite. Mikloth was the chief officer and his division consisted of 24,000.

5.verse: The third army commander, for the third month, was Benaiah son of Jehoiada the kohen. He was leader of his division, which consisted of 24,000.

6.verse: This was Benaiah, who was a mighty man of the 30 and had charge over the 30. Ammizabad his son was over his division.

7.verse: The fourth commander, for the fourth month, was Asahel brother of Joab. Zebadiah, his son, succeeded him. His division consisted of 24,000.

8.verse: The fifth commander, for the fifth month, was Shamhuth the Izrahite. His division consisted of 24,000.

9.verse: The sixth commander, for the sixth month, was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite. His division consisted of 24,000.

10.verse: The seventh commander, for the seventh month, was Heletz the Pelonite, from the children of Ephraim. His division consisted of 24,000.

11.verse: The eighth commander, for the eighth month, was Sibbcai the Hushathite from the Zerahites. His division consisted of 24,000.

12.verse: The ninth commander, for the ninth month, was Abiezer the Anathotite, of the Benjamites. His division consisted of 24,000.

13.verse: The tenth commander, for the tenth month, was Maharai the Netophathite of the Zerahites. His division consisted of 24,000.

14.verse: The eleventh commander, for the eleventh month, was Benaiah the Pirathonite a descendant of Ephraim. His division consisted of 24,000.

15.verse: The twelfth commander, for the twelfth month, was Heldai the Netophathite of Othniel. His division consisted of 24,000.

16.verse: Furthermore, over the tribes of Israel: of the Reubenites: Eliezer son of Zichri was the chief officer; of the Simeonites: Shephatiah son of Maacah;

17.verse: of Levi: Hashabiah son of Kemuel; of Aaron: Zadok;

18.verse: of Judah: Elihu, one of David’s brothers; of Issachar: Omri son of Michael;

19.verse: of Zebulun: Ishmaiah son of Obadiah; of Naphtali: Jerimoth son of Azriel;

20.verse: of the children of Ephraim: Hoshea son of Azaziah; of the half-tribe of Manasseh: Joel son of Pedaiah;

21.verse: of the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead: Iddo son of Zechariah; of Benjamin: Jaasiel son of Abner;

22.verse: of Dan: Azarel son of Jeroham. These were the officers of the tribes of Israel.

23.verse: But David did not count those 20 years old and under, because ADONAI had said He would multiply Israel as the stars of heaven.

24.verse: Joab the son of Zeruiah began to count them, but did not finish. Wrath came upon Israel for this and the number was not entered into the account in the chronicles of King David.

25.verse: Over the king’s storehouses: Azmaveth son of Adiel. Over the storehouses in the fields, in the cities, in the villages and in the citadels: Jonathan son of Uzziah;

26.verse: over the field laborers for tilling the ground: Ezri the son of Chelub;

27.verse: over the vineyards: Shimei the Ramathite; over the produce of the vineyards for the wine cellars: Zabdi the Shiphmite;

28.verse: over the olive trees and the sycamore trees in the lowland: Baal-hanan the Gederite; over the cellars of oil: Joash;

29.verse: over the cattle grazing in Sharon: Shirtai the Sharonite; over the cattle grazing in the valleys: Shaphat son of Adlai;

30.verse: over the camels: Obil the Ishmaelite; over the donkeys: Jehdeiah the Meronothite;

31.verse: and over the flocks: Jaziz the Hagrite. All these were stewards over the property of King David.

32.verse: Also Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counselor, learned man and scribe. Jehiel son of Hachmoni tutored the king’s sons.

33.verse: Ahithophel was the king’s counselor. Hushai the Arkite was the king’s friend.

34.verse: Ahithophel was succeeded by Jehoiada son of Benaiah and by Abiatar. Joab was the commander of the king’s army.

1.verse: Men and Materials - Now David assembled all the leaders of Israel in Jerusalem—the tribal officers, the commanders of the divisions that served the king, the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds, and the stewards over all the property and livestock of the king and of his sons, along with the high officials, the mighty warriors and all the men of valor.

2.verse: Then King David rose to his feet and said, “Listen to me, my brothers and my people! As for me, it was in my heart to build a resting place for the Ark of the Covenant of ADONAI and for the footstool of our God. So I made the preparations for the building.

3.verse: But God said to me, ‘You will not build a House for My name because you are a man of war and have shed blood.’

4.verse: Yet ADONAI, the God of Israel, has chosen me out of all my ancestral house to be king over Israel forever. For He chose Judah as ruler, and of the house of Judah, my father’s house, and of my father’s sons, He took pleasure in me to make me king over all Israel.

5.verse: Moreover, of all my sons—for ADONAI has given me many sons—He has chosen Solomon my son to sit on the throne of the kingdom of ADONAI over Israel.

6.verse: “He said to me, ‘Solomon your son will build My House and My courts for I have chosen him to be a son to Me and I will be a father to him.

7.verse: I will establish his kingdom forever, if he resolutely observes My mitzvot and My ordinances as at this day.’

8.verse: Now therefore, in the sight of all Israel, the congregation of ADONAI and in the hearing of our God, observe and seek all the mitzvot of ADONAI your God so that you may possess this good land and may bequeath it to your children after you forever.

9.verse: “Now you, Solomon my son, know the God of your father and serve Him with a whole heart and with a willing mind; for ADONAI searches all hearts and understands every intent of the thoughts. If you seek Him, He will be found by you. But if you forsake Him, He will reject you forever.

10.verse: Consider now, for ADONAI has chosen you to build a House for the Sanctuary. Chazak! And do it!”

11.verse: Then David gave Solomon his son the pattern of the porch, its houses, its storerooms, its upper rooms, its inner rooms, and the place of atonement;

12.verse: and the plan of all that he had by the Ruach for the courts of the House of ADONAI and all the surrounding rooms, for the storehouses of the House of God and for the treasuries of the dedicated things;

13.verse: also for the divisions of the kohanim and the Levites, for all the tasks of the avodah of the House of ADONAI, and for all the vessels of avodah in the House of ADONAI.

14.verse: For gold, the weight of gold for all vessels of every kind of avodah, and silver, the weight of silver for all vessels for every type of avodah;

15.verse: and the weight for the gold menorot and their gold lamps, including the weight of each menorah and its lamps, for the silver menorot, including the weight of each menorah and its lamps according to the use of each menorah;

16.verse: also the weight of gold for the tables of the rows of bread, for every table and silver for the silver tables;

17.verse: and the forks, the basins, and the pitchers of pure gold, and for the golden bowls with the weight for every bowl, and for the silver bowls with the weight for every bowl;

18.verse: and for the altar of incense with the weight of refined gold; and gold for the form of the chariot—the cheruvim—that spread out their wings covering the Ark of the Covenant of ADONAI.

19.verse: “All this I put in writing is from the hand of ADONAI upon me as He gave me insight regarding the plan of all the works.”

20.verse: Also David said to his son Solomon: “Chazak! And be courageous, and do it! Do not be afraid or dismayed, for ADONAI Elohim my God is with you. He will not fail you or forsake you until all the work for the avodah of the House of ADONAI is finished.

21.verse: Now behold, here are the divisions of the kohanim and the Levites for all the avodah of the House of God, and with you in all the work are willing men, skilled in all types of tasks. Also the officials and all the people are at your command.”

1.verse: David Commissions His Son - Then King David said to the entire assembly: “My son Solomon, the one whom God has chosen, is young and inexperienced and the task is great, for the palace is not for man but for ADONAI Elohim.

2.verse: Now I have made every effort to prepare for the House of my God gold for the golden objects, silver for silver, copper for copper, iron for iron, and wood for wood; onyx stones and inlay stones, stones of antimony and varigated colors—every kind of precious stones and marble in abundance.

3.verse: Moreover, in my devotion to the House of my God, I have given over my private treasure of gold and silver to the House of my God, in addition to all that I have already supplied for the holy House:

4.verse: 3,000 gold talents of gold from Ophir, and 7,000 talents of refined silver to overlay the walls of the houses—

5.verse: gold for golden objects and silver for silver for all the work—into the hands of craftsmen. Who then will offer willingly, consecrating himself this day to ADONAI?”

6.verse: Then the leaders of the clans, the officials of the tribes of Israel, the commanders of thousands and hundreds and the supervisors over the king’s work contributed willingly.

7.verse: They gave for the service of the House of God: 5,000 talents and 10,000 darics of gold, 10,000 talents of silver, 18,000 talents of bronze and 100,000 talents of iron.

8.verse: Whoever possessed stones gave them to the treasury of the House of ADONAI in the care of Jehiel the Gershonite.

9.verse: Then the people rejoiced over their freewill offerings because with a whole heart they offered willingly to ADONAI. King David also rejoiced with great joy.

10.verse: David blessed ADONAI before the whole congregation saying, “Blessed are You, ADONAI, God of Israel our father, from eternity to eternity!

11.verse: Yours, ADONAI, is the greatness, the power and the splendor, and the victory and the majesty, indeed everything in heaven and earth. Yours is the kingdom, ADONAI and You are exalted above all.

12.verse: Both riches and honor come from You. You rule over everything. In Your hand is power and might, in Your hand, to magnify and give strength to all.

13.verse: Now, our God, we give you thanks and praise Your glorious Name.

14.verse: “But who am I and who are my people that we should be able to offer so willingly as this? For everything comes from You, and from Your hand we have given to You.

15.verse: For we are sojourners before You, mere transients like our fathers. Our days on the earth are like a shadow, without security.

16.verse: ADONAI Eloheinu, all this abundance that we have laid aside to build You a House for Your holy Name is from Your hand; it all belongs to You.

17.verse: I know, my God, that You search the heart and take pleasure in uprightness. With integrity of heart I have willingly offered all these things. And now I have seen with joy Your people who are present here willingly contribute to You.

18.verse: ADONAI, God of Abraham, Isaac and Israel our fathers, preserve forever such motives and thoughts in the heart of Your people and make their heart constant toward You.

19.verse: As for my son Solomon, give him a whole heart to keep Your mitzvot, Your decrees and Your statutes, and to fulfill them all and to build the Temple for which I have made provision.”

20.verse: Then David said to the whole congregation, “Now bless ADONAI your God.” So the whole congregation blessed ADONAI, the God of their fathers. They bowed down and fell prostrate before ADONAI and the king.

21.verse: Solomon Acclaimed King - The next day, they sacrificed sacrifices to ADONAI and offered burnt offerings to ADONAI; 1,000 bulls, 1,000 rams and 1,000 lambs, along with their drink offerings and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.

22.verse: So they ate and drank before ADONAI on that day with great joy. Then they designated Solomon the son of David as king a second time, anointing him before ADONAI as ruler and Zadok as kohen.

23.verse: So Solomon sat on the throne of ADONAI as king instead of his father David. He prospered and all Israel obeyed him.

24.verse: All the officials and mighty men, as well as all the sons of King David, pledged their hand in support of King Solomon.

25.verse: ADONAI highly exalted Solomon in the sight of all Israel and bestowed on him such royal majesty as had never been on any king before him in Israel.

26.verse: Now David son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.

27.verse: The length of his reign over Israel was 40 years. He reigned in Hebron seven years and he reigned in Jerusalem 33 years.

28.verse: He died at a good old age, full of days, riches and honor, and his son Solomon became king in his place.

29.verse: Now the acts of King David, the first and the last, behold, are written in the chronicles of Samuel the seer, in the chronicles of Nathan the prophet and in the chronicles of Gad the seer

30.verse: together with all his reign, his power and the events that involved him, Israel and all the kingdoms of the lands.
